caption: Delicious and friendly!!!

Great new restaurant in Huntsville. Much higher quality Mexican food than the countless other Mexican restaurants in town. You can go Tapas style and order a bunch of small plates, and they have full size entrees as well. The food was fresh and service was great!

Absolutely LOVE La Esquina Cocina! After the second time going here I decided I had to leave a review. The food here is full of flavor that definitely doesn’t disappoint. Food portions are more than enough. Margaritas are on point! So delicious! The service here is great and food wait time is super fast. Definitely my family’s favorite tapas bar & restaurant in town!
Taco Tuesday! Good choice.
Had the chillaquiles for brunch... Excellent service, fresh food, and distinct flavors. You won't regret eating here!
food was cold. service was nice. long wait for tables, and for food
The food was Great! My wife and I really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Our server was amazing also.
Delicious food, great service, and relaxed atmosphere made for an excellent experience. Highly recommend!
Excellent service, food, and drinks.  First class Mexican cuisine with dishes you won’t find at even above average Mexican restaurants
Great restaurant! Unique menu and delicious food. Service is outstanding as well.
Nice atmosphere and service was excellent.  Very pricey though and food was just ok.  Worth a visit and I'll be back.

Dined here on multiple occasions-  delicious food and margs. Outside of your standard mexican restaurant offerings.  Last night we ordered some of our favorites, the loaded queso and the tuna tostado and were less than impressed.  It wasn't nearly as tasty as it used to be and the presentation wasn't as good either.  We also had to go inside to find out waitress to ask for the bill.   Whatever changes were made, I wish you would go back to the old ways!
First timer here. Will definitely be back. Had the Asada Bowl and tasted fantastic. The prices are a little on the higher side but given the location, is expected.
Truly was perfect in every way... the service, the food, and the cleanliness! We have definitely found a new regular "spot"!
Great cocktails and perfectly cooked food

Tex mex food. Nice location that’s been refurbished completely. Inside the building is very loud. Although the place wasn’t full some in our party had difficulty hearing at our table. Below average value for the food. Wish we’d gone to Rosie’s or Phil’s.
We had dinner there last Saturday night with no reservation and the hostess and owner were more than great full to seat us quickly. The food and the service is always excellent!

This place was... well, AWESOME! Drink wine and margs there because they’re absolutely delicious. I highly suggest trying everything else too (they’re queso and quac is amazing). It only took 45 minutes to get great tacos, great drinks, and even better service during a super busy time. Waiter checked on us multiple times in an hour (thanks Jesse!!!), and was so nice the entire time! Highly recommend and always a stop whenever I visit HSV!!

Best way to dine here is to bring a big group of friends and indulge in all the fresh and authentic tapas while sipping on incredible hand-crafted drinks. You have to try the spicy margarita, any of the seasonal margaritas, and the guava paloma. They just added a house-made horchata cocktail which I'm so excited to try! The tacos are also a MUST. My favorites are the cochinita pibil, asian, and baja pescado. The salmon entree is absolutely amazing as well. The waiters and waitresses are warm, friendly, and definitely elevate the experience overall.

Visited Jan 2021 This place is a little unique for the area.  They don't have free chips and salsa, but it's more of a tapas restaurant than Mexican food.  They serve a large variety of tacos, plus some other delicious and creative dishes.  They have margs (rocks, not frozen) and some other cocktails.  The atmosphere has a Spanish tapas feel, and the staff was helpful and friendly.  Everything seemed clean and well organized.  The location is also pretty great.  There's a rooftop bar right next door, and it's walkable to all of downtown.  Would go again.

Disappointed, service was slow having to wave down our waitress several times. Pricing was different on 2 different menus at the table and when the bill came price was higher than both, for the bowls. Very noisy interior. The highest price Mexican food I have enter paid with no noticeable increased quality or value.

Highly recommend La Esquina Covina! Whether it's dinner, or brunch, your tummy will not be disappointed.  Totopos with Queso/guacamole is a necessity for your appetizer choice. You have to try the spicy margaritas as well💗

If you want great Mexican food in Huntsville go to La Esquina! The fish tacos are so good and the waiters and waitresses are incredibly nice and will make sure your water never goes below half way! Amazing!

La Esquina is amazing! I recently moved to Alabama and have struggled to find really good food...until I found La Esquina. The food is delicious and service is fast and good. I always go for the Fish or Carne Asada tacos. If you haven’t tried La Esquina yet, you must!

This was such a new experience in Mexican cuisine for me! I think of Huntsville of having a good variety of Mexican food places to choose from and this one fits right in. The atmosphere and presentation was that of a high end restaurant. The food was fresh and delicious! The queso fundito dip was so unique. It wasn't like a traditional queso blanco and I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it!
Delicious,  highly recommended.  Brunch was Amazing

This place was... well, it looks great. Drink wine there. Dont do anything else. It took 45 minutes to get way overpriced tacos that came out cold and chewed like a fishing lure. Waiter checked on us 2 times in an hour. Wouldn't reccomend
Authentic Mexican food made from scratch very nice atmosphere indoors and outdoors.

Stood in line for 30 minutes in an attempt to purchase 2 beverages, only to have 3 people cut in front of us. But the best part was when a guy walks up behind us and yells to the bartender his order and he took it.
One of the best mexican food restaurants in town. The chips are extra crunchy and salty, and the carne tacos are fantastic.
Great brunch

Was seated in one came to acknowledge my husband and I. Yet the guests that came in after us had water and chips and salsa on table. Finally the hostess came and got us water and when my husband said he was ready to order she told us a waiter was coming. Several minutes later we got a chance to order sadly we got our food and it was not up to order steak dry no potatoes no salsa chips. I do not recommend this place we left very upset, disrespected and unsatisfied. We were treated wrongly. Poor service know respect toward people of color. Never will I return here!
The Mar y Tierra (ribeye) was spectacular.  I absolutely love this place!!  Michael H
Kati and Bryan are the best. Great drinks by professional bartenders. Food was top notch as well.
Our food was spectacular and the drinks were great.  We had a flight of margaritas and a variety of items from their small plates selection.
The attention to detail is very much appreciated. The tamal was 🔥🔥🔥
Great food!
Interesting tapas and great chorizo artichoke dip.

We had an amazing time here. We had several tapas dishes which were lovely, including the delicious empanadas. The atmosphere had lots of good energy and the service was responsive and courteous. My only complaint is the salsa they serve with their tortilla chips was not as good as I feel it should be for such an establishment. My advice, jazz up your salsa!!!

La Esquina is pretty good! I saw it while I was home driving downtown, so I figured I'd try it. My mom, husband and I usually eat Mexican food on Friday nights whenever my husband and I are in town. We normally go to Phil's but didn't feel like driving. Downtown is right around the corner from where my mom lives so this location was convenient. The Friday afternoon we went was perfect. The weather was great and it was a good day to eat Mexican. The inside is very spacious. The seating was 6 ft apart if not more. We felt comfortable eating out right after COVID. Our waiter was very nice and accommodating. I also love tapas style restaurants so this was a plus. I love being able to try multiple dishes at once.  My mom, husband and I all ordered a bunch of tapas and shared. We didn't share the single items like tacos but everything else was shareable.  My husband and I started off by ordering margaritas. I had a Watermelon Margarita and he had the Top Shelf, both were good! I was pleased with the balance of sweetness to alcohol my drink had. It wasn't overly sweet but the alcohol was balanced and not overpowering.  Now onto the food....  TOTOPOS W/ 2 SALSAS - YUMMM! Corn chips with roasted tomato serrano salsa and tomatillo salsa. These were probably the best chips we've had in a long time. They were seasoned with the perfect amount of salt and fried perfectly! The crunch with the salsas was so good! The salsas were also flavorful and tasted homemade.  ARTICHOKE CHORIZO DIP - GOOD! Homemade chorizo, artichokes, cream salsa. Side of totopos. This dip was very good and flavorful. I really enjoyed this dip.  ENCHILADAS DE CANASTA - DECENT! Potato hash, guajillo salsa, cabbage, sour cream and queso fresco. This was decent. It wasn't bad but it also wasn't anything special.  POLLO AL PASTOR TACO - GOOD! Grilled chicken marinated in roasted pineapple and achiote. Chipotle salsa, cilantro and onions. This taco was small and only comes with one. It was very flavorful and I love the play on a traditional Al Pastor taco (pork and pineapple). The chicken was tender and yummy! The pineapple adds that sweet kick!  CHORIZO TACO - GOOD! Homemade pork sausage, cilantro, onions, roasted tomato salsa. This taco also only comes with one. It was pretty good! I enjoyed the flavor. It wasn't the best chorizo taco I've had but it was decent.  FISH EMPANADAS - DECENT!  Lightly fried turnover, white fish, sweet peppers, pico de gallo. This was ok to me. I didn't feel it was anything special. Not bad but nothing to talk about.  FRIJOLES FRITOS - YUM! Peruvian refried beans, queso fresco crumble. Side of totopos. This dip is simple yet flavorful. I enjoyed this dip a lot!  Overall, La Esquina was pretty good. I would come back whenever I'm in downtown Huntsville and want Mexican.
Very good food, but the drinks were mostly ice. 5 star when they get the drinks down.

We have stopped by a few times and every time has been excellent.  That is saying a lot for a restaurant that opened just before the covid pandemic.  I have many friends and family in the service industry and It is extremely hard to run a restaurant right now.  The drinks are amazing. The Paloma in particular is a very good version of a drink which is hard to improve upon.  We have tried quite a few of the tapas and charcuterie.  Some of the reviews mentioned a lack of flavor.  That is definitely not our experience. The dishes are not salt and cheese bombs but the flavor is a very creative and unique take on Mexican/Central American home cooking I have had the joy to experience. The pricing is good as well.  Last time we ate here, my wife and I had a cocktail each, several taps, and left full and happy after a good tip for less than $60.  Can’t ask for much better!!!
We were so excited to try this new restaurant but were sadly let down. The prices are way too high for the portion size. There were also way too many gnats flying around.
The wait time is about 15 mins for a drink. If you’re in no rush stop by.
Great food. Great service. Simple as that!
This is not practicing safe social distancing right now. All for some drinks. There is no take-out food available here.  This is shameful.

Offers something different for Huntsville and Mexican food. The menu has a range of options and I feel like we tried most of them due to the small-plate tapas format. The salsas were good but our chips (totopos) while tasted good, were so greasy. The guacamole was very tasty, but the artichoke chipotle dip needed some more kick. It was a little bland. The sopes were good, but also seemed to lack a punch of flavor. The stuffed pepper was delicious, as were the empanadas. I think this is a great place to go to have some cocktails and an appetizer or two, but having dinner seemed a little awkward with all of these little plates sitting around everywhere and trying to figure out how to share them. The margaritas were good, but don’t expect a margarita glass. They are served in small short cocktail glasses. For a real dinner, I personally like to have my own plate of food consisting of an entree and some sides. For anyone on a budget, keep in mind that your bill can easily sneak up on you. It’s easy for a couple eating and having a couple of cocktails to run up over a $125+ tab in no time. The space itself is new and cool, but the acoustics are extremely bad. There is music playing, but you can’t hear it. You do feel like you are hearing at least 50 conversations going on at the same time when it’s busy. There is nothing to absorb the sound so it just bounces around everywhere. I think this could be a great addition to downtown with a little learning curve on how to best utilize what they offer.

We had an amazing first experience at La Esquina Cocina. As a group of 6 of us we tried 18 different tapas (they recommend 2-3 per person) and there was not a single thing we tried that we didn't enjoy. The size of the plates were perfect for a tapas/small plates restaurant, and I loved the ability to try so many different things. The price ended up less than I thought for a tapas restaurant of this quality, we will definitely be back! I can't pick a favorite but a few I recommend are the Empanadas de Carne, Chile en nogada, and the Enchiladas Verde
Creative menu. Food was original and delicious. Great presentation and warm, friendly staff.
The tapas are full of flavor and are fairly portioned. The cocktails are top notch. I’m excited to revisit La Esquina many times.

It looks cute, but the food was extremely underwhelming and unimaginative. For a tapas place, which should focus on bold flavors, everything we tried was bland. They didn't use a single spice or pepper in any dish we tried. The tapas were disproportionate for sharing. The cocktail program was their strongest factor; however, some of the bartenders were less skilled than others, which came through in the drinks. For a brand-new restaurant, upkeep on the bathrooms were not a priority. Overall, it was not a satisfactory experience.

I gave La Esquina at try today! I liked the chicken taco and I like the prime rib taco, but the carne asada taco was a little too rubbery for me. The green salsa tasted amazing, and the red salsa needed a little help.  Customer service left much to be desired. We had an issue with our order, they attempted to fix it, but didn't. When we brought it to their attention that it was incorrect again, they refused to fix it. Overall, the food was just okay for the prices to be what they are. The lack of quality customer service is enough to make me not go back.

When we arrived we were told to expect 30-45 minutes wait. Fortunately we found two seats at the bar (if we had waited 45 minutes we would have been much more disillusioned). This is first and foremost a tapas restaurant. That said, many tapas restaurants expect you to share bites with the table, each person ordering something different. Apparently everything on the menu (except the designated “shareables”-a half chicken, a 16-Oz steak or short rib enchiladas, none of which I consider easily shareable unless you aren’t very hungry, especially served with just tortillas) was Ala Carte. Despite the menu listing a plural item, you get one-see the Gorditas entry on the menu. But even though there were two ordering and we each ordered a different taco, they brought both small tacos (3” tortillas) on one plate (at least should have provided a second plate or two smaller plates-we had to ask for a second plate). We also ordered Gorditas. They did bring these on individual plates. One Gordita per serving. Small Gordita. Very tough masa cake for my Gordita, which I had to cut with a knife, and much of the bottom of the masa cake was too tough too chew. On the positive side, service was decent, food came out fairly quickly, though I would rather the food all be brought at the same time. The flavors WERE very good! And the Paloma that Brent made was one of the best I’ve had (but for $13 it should be). Value for $? I had a small taco, a small Gordita and a good drink for $26 before tip. I left hungry. One last word: several menu items are marked as Vegan on the menu but 4 of the 7 of those contain dairy, either cheese or cream, so if you are a strict vegan, read the menu carefully. They are new. Maybe they will make adjustments that improve the experience. I will try again and hopefully can give a better review.

Fantastic! I loved everything thing I ordered.  The menu has many options and several things I didn't know what they were, but I think eating there a few time would solve that. I would highly recommend it.  The fish empenadas were my favorite item, and the guacamole was great as well.

After excitedly waiting for the opening we went for lunch today. Very disappointing. The chairs for starters were extremely uncomfortable,  We ordered a few Tapas and some over priced Guac and chips. We found the food to be very bland. We asked for hot sauce to add our own flavor....one server looked at us like we had horns, left and never came back. Our server was shocked at the request and said they don’t have any. They don’t carry bottled water which matters to some people. All in all it was $61 before tip for a lunch that was not very flavorful.We will never go back!
If you're reading reviews of La Esquina Cocina, just stop. Drop by and grab a bite, will will not be disappointed. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The decorations are warm and modern.

My wife and I decided to try the newly opened La Esquina Cocina restaurant for lunch. The contemporary room is large and nicely appointed. The concrete floors and open ceiling are what seem to be in vogue at the moment but make for a noisy experience. They have a full bar, several beers on tap and two TVs.  The menu is heavily oriented toward tapas with some enticing twists. We ordered three tacos and a side of beans and rice (I miss Chiefs' table). With one coffee and water, the bill came to just over $35.  A bit on the pricey side, but for that price we expected great things.  What we got was just okay. My wife felt the chips were stale, the tacos were barely warm and the beans and rice cold. We were both taken aback by tiny portions of rice and beans at over $5 each.  Our waitress was very nice, but rarely seen. She never refilled my wife's water and I had to ask twice for a refill on coffee and twice for the check, with extended wait times between each request.  We'll probably try them again after they have had some time to work out these issues.

Fabulous tapas bar to fill a niche in downtown.  Food was good, steak was a little tough, the tuna tapas was AMAZING as was the banana infused old fashioned.  It was really busy and the staff were on point with service.  Good start for a brand new place, I'll definitely be back.  Only downside, the font on the menu was incredibly small.
Interesting menu, delicious food and diligent service. I found the tapas portions to be generous.
Authentic, upscale Tapas. Every dish was delicious and the cocktails were unique and wonderful!

I just had lunch there and my feelings are mixed.  The menu is a tapas menu.  No entrees. The tapas items are priced close to entree prices, though they are, of course, small.  So, for $20, after tax, before tip, I had two rather small fish empanadas and a small serving of Peruvian refried beans, which were served just above lukewarm.  The reason my feelings are mixed is that the empanadas were EXCELLENT, top notch, no reservations.  I would really like to see this place offer lunch combinations or otherwise special lunch prices to allow for a full meal for under $12 that would fill up this 220 lb man. ;)

After watching the development of La Esquina Concina from afar, my wife and I jumped on the opportunity to go on their official opening night, Feb 17th 2020.  We were greeted and seated immediately as we arrived around 6pm, by 7pm the house was around 90% seated and packed with patrons.  Our server was knowledgeable with the food menu and offered some of his favorites. Food (10/10): We choose to try the Tamala oaxaqueño, artichoke and chorizo dip,  empanadas de carne, and tacos: Pollo el pastor, baja style mahi, and the shortrib (can't remember the name). Everything was cooked perfectly and the flavors were complicated but worked incredibly well and seemed to develop more after each bite. Drink (10/10): For adult libations we had Brent, one of the areas best bartenders that we've frequently had incredible cocktails from, make us a seasonal Gin cocktail.  I'm not 100% sure what was in it besides Bombay Sapphire, Grapefruit, either a rubarb syrup or aperol, and it garnished with orange peel essence and a slightly smoked rosemary twig for aromatics. Overall (10/10): We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit, we will be back within a week to try out the rest of the menu. This restaurant is something that everyone should try as it easily has some of the most developed flavors in the downtown area.
This isn't your typical Tex Mex restaurant.  Be prepared to try dishes that may be outside of your comfort zone.  You won't be disappointed!

We were invited to attend their Soft Opening.  What an amazing experience!  We had the tuna, guacamole and both the shrimp and mahi tacos. Talk about fresh.  The Tuna alone was worth the trip!  I'd personally comment on the Tacos, but since my wife wouldn't share, I just have to assume they were excellent.   Great place to socialize with a wonderful atmosphere,  super friendly staff and phenomenal food.  Thank you Lauren for the invite.  We will be back!

In downtown Huntsville, a mashup of Mexican, Tex/Mex in an open and airy casual industrial eatery. La Esquina Cocina means "the corner kitchen" and true to its name offers everything from scratch chicken soup to aged NY Strip Steak.  A creative menu with plenty of options with veg based plates, several chicken plates, a few fish and of course several pork and beef choices.  One of their sharable selections (chicken and the short ribs are our favorite ) with a couple single plates make for a great meal.  A couple notes - we're not drinkers but the bar set up looked outstanding - and they support several local farms providing cheese, vegs and meats. While open just a little later than most - check the hours daily - I'll still add this as a great addition to Huntsville's short supply of food choices for those of us who prefer a later sitting.
